moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3 Bc5 3. Nf3 d6 4. b3: black is developing on d4, so to maintain equality, white fianchetto's
moves.4... Nc6 5. Bb2 Nb4 6. Bc4 Bg4 7. Rc1: white brings in his queen rook to help his overloaded queen
moves.7... Ne7 8. O-O Ng6 9. Nd5 Nxd5 10. Bxd5: black looked to occupy f4 with his knight, but it took him 3 moves to get him there.  White gets a free pawn.
moves.21... Nf4+ 22. Kg1 Bd7 23. Qf3 Bh3 24. R: white trades and gets a free knight
moves.26... Bh3 27. e5 dxe5 28. fxe5 h6 29. Re: Attacks Black's light bishop forcing him to move.
moves.29... Bg4 30. a3: the real reason for 29. Re3 ... 30. a3
moves.32... Rbd8 33. Rd3 c6 34. Bxc6: target of opportunity: another free pawn
moves.34... Bg6 35. Rd2 Bf5 36. h4 g6 37. f4 h: order is everything.  White gets two bishops and a rook for a rook ( 6) by checking the king first and then recapturing the rook.
moves.43... Kh7 44. Bxd2 Rd8 45. Bd5: defends against Rxd2 and attacks the base of the pawn chain f7
